boundary_four.text: {batter} plays a magnificent cover drive! It races away across the turf and beats the fielder to the ropes for four.
Short and punished! {batter} swivels on the back foot and pulls it powerfully to the square leg boundary for a cracking four.
A juicy full toss from {bowler} and {batter} doesn't miss out! Smacked straight down the ground, beating the man at long-on for four.
Thick outside edge! It flies past the diving slip fielder and races down to the vacant third man region for four lucky runs.
Delicate touch! {batter} opens the face of the bat at the last moment and guides it fine past the keeper for a boundary.
Powerful sweep shot! {batter} gets down on one knee and slog sweeps it hard through mid-wicket, one bounce and over the rope for four.
Driven on the up! {batter} punches it through the gap at extra cover, the fielder gives chase but the ball wins the race.
Beautifully timed straight drive! {bowler} can only watch as the ball races past him to the long-off boundary for a classic four.
Carved through point! {batter} makes room and slashes hard, the ball rockets through the infield and hits the fence in a flash.
Flicked off the pads with elegance! {batter} uses his wrists beautifully to send the ball racing to the fine leg boundary for four.
Width offered and width taken! {batter} throws his hands at a wide one outside off and it screams through backward point for four.
That's been dispatched! {bowler} strays onto the pads and {batter} whips it away through mid-wicket with disdain. Four runs.
Reverse sweep! {batter} gets into an unorthodox position and paddles it past short third man. Inventive shot, four runs.
Back of a length and {batter} rocks onto the back foot, punching it through the covers with authority. The outfielder can only wave at it.
Pitched up and {batter} leans into a gorgeous on-drive. Bisects mid-on and mid-wicket perfectly, that's four all the way.
Inside edge and it runs away fine! {batter} was trying to work it square but gets a fortunate boundary through the vacant leg side.
Short and sat up nicely! {batter} was waiting for that, rolls the wrists on a pull shot that races to deep mid-wicket for four.
Ramp shot! {batter} goes down early and helps it over the keeper's head. Unorthodox but effective, and it reaches the boundary.
Length ball on the stumps and {batter} lofts it cleanly over the bowler's head. Not enough to clear the rope but it bounces into the fence. Four.
Drops it short and {batter} is all over it! A fierce cut shot that bisects point and gully and rattles the advertising boards.
Tossed up by {bowler} and {batter} goes after it! Lovely use of the feet, gets to the pitch and drills it through extra cover for four.
Late cut played expertly! {batter} waits, waits, and at the last instant rolls the wrists to steer it past gully. Class shot, four runs.
Overpitched and punished! {batter} barely has to move his feet, just presents the full face of the bat and times it to perfection through mid-off.
Creamed off the front foot! {batter} gets forward and absolutely middles it through the covers. That is pure timing, races away for four.
Uppish but safe! {batter} drives on the up, it flies between mid-off and the bowler, neither can react in time. Four more.

boundary_six.text: That is absolutely massive! {batter} gets hold of it and launches it high over long-on for a huge six!
In the slot and dispatched! {batter} clears the front leg and smokes it straight back over the bowler's head for a maximum.
Top edge on the hook shot! It somehow carries all the way over the fine leg boundary, six runs to the total.
Dancing down the track! {batter} meets the pitch of the ball and lifts it gracefully over the extra cover fence for a stunning six.
Power hitting at its best! {batter} muscles a short delivery deep into the stands at mid-wicket, checking to see if the ball is still in the ground!
Clean strike! {batter} picks the length early and deposits it into the second tier over long-off. That's a monster hit!
Slog sweep connected perfectly! The ball sails high into the night sky and lands deep in the crowd at square leg for six.
Upper cut over third man! {batter} uses the pace of the ball brilliantly to steer it over the ropes for a cheeky six.
Stand and deliver! {batter} doesn't even bother moving his feet, just swings hard and the ball disappears over cow corner. Maximum!
That has gone a long way! {batter} gets underneath a length ball and launches it miles over long-on. The crowd erupts!
Reverse sweep for six! {batter} switches hands and paddles it high over short third man. Incredible audacity, incredible execution.
Steps out and launches it downtown! {batter} charges {bowler}, gets to the pitch and sends it soaring over long-off for a massive six.
Flat-batted and powerful! {batter} picks up a length ball and hammers it flat over mid-wicket. Barely got any elevation but had sheer brute force.
Back foot punch over cover! {batter} leans back and lofts it with a high elbow. Beautiful, almost effortless six.
One hand off the bat and it still clears the boundary! {batter} shows his raw power with a one-handed flick over square leg for six.
Ramp shot for six! {batter} gets under the bouncer and helps it over the fine leg fence. Uses the pace of {bowler} against him.
That's been crunched! Short from {bowler} and {batter} absolutely murders the pull shot. It clears mid-wicket with yards to spare. Six!
Into the second tier! {batter} skips down the track and goes absolutely ballistic over long-on. The ball might still be going!
Flicked high and handsome! {batter} picks it off the toes and sends it sailing over deep square leg. Effortless power on display.
Picked the slower ball! {batter} reads the change of pace, waits back and heaves it over the long-on boundary. Smart hitting.

wicket_bowled.text: Clean bowled! {bowler} produces a peach of a delivery that beats the outside edge and crashes into the off stump.
Knocked him over! The middle stump is cartwheeling out of the ground! {batter} is completely beaten for pace.
Through the gate! A beautiful spinning delivery drifts in and turns away to rattle the timber. {batter} looks back in disbelief.
Played all around it! {batter} tries to work it to the leg side but misses completely, the ball hits the base of leg stump.
Chopped onto his own stumps! {batter} tries to cut a ball too close to the body and drags it back onto the wicket.
Yorker! Right in the blockhole and {batter} can't dig it out. The stumps are shattered, what a delivery from {bowler}!
Bowled around his legs! {batter} shuffles across and misses the flick, the ball clips leg stump on its way through. He's got to go.
Off stump out of the ground! {bowler} nips one back in from outside off, {batter} shouldered arms and paid the ultimate price.
Timber! {bowler} gets it to jag back in sharply, beats the inside edge and hits the top of off. Brilliant bowling.
Stumps everywhere! A searing yorker from {bowler} that {batter} had absolutely no answer to. All three stumps disturbed.
Gone! {bowler} tosses it up, draws {batter} forward, the ball dips and turns past the bat to hit the top of middle. Masterful spin bowling.
Dragged on! {batter} tries to drive but gets an inside edge onto the stumps. He stands there for a moment, can't believe it. Has to walk.

wicket_caught.text: Up in the air... and taken safely! {batter} tries to go big but mistimes it, finding the fielder at long-off who makes no mistake.
Edged and gone! A faint tickle through to the keeper who accepts the catch with glee. {bowler} gets his man!
Straight to the fielder! {batter} drives firmly but picks out the man at cover point perfectly. A very soft dismissal in the end.
A stunning diving catch! {batter} thought he had cleared the infield but the fielder at mid-wicket pulls off a blinder to his right!
Top edge goes high into the night sky! The wicketkeeper calls for it, runs back, and takes a well-judged catch under pressure.
Caught at slip! A lovely delivery that shapes away, takes the outside edge, and carries comfortably to first slip.
Holes out to deep mid-wicket! {batter} tried to clear the fence but didn't quite get enough on it. The fielder judges it perfectly.
What a catch! Running back from mid-on, the fielder takes it over his shoulder at full stretch. {batter} can't believe it, that looked like six.
Sliced straight to backward point! {batter} threw his hands at a wide delivery and found the fielder's chest. A regulation catch in the end.
Leading edge! {batter} tries to work it to the leg side, gets a leading edge and it pops up gently to mid-off. Simple catch, big wicket.
Caught behind! That nipped away from {bowler}, took the edge and the keeper dived to his right to take a sharp chance. Great reflexes.
Toe-ends it to long-on! {batter} was looking to go big over the top but didn't get the elevation. Comfortable catch for the outfielder.
Feathered through! The slightest of edges off {batter}'s glove and the keeper snaffles it. {bowler} knew it immediately, that's a brilliant piece of bowling.
Skied it! {batter} gets under a full delivery and spoons it straight up in the air. The mid-off fielder settles under it comfortably. Dolly catch.
Juggled but held! The fielder at deep square leg gets underneath it, fumbles the first attempt but recovers brilliantly. {batter} has to depart.

wicket_lbw.text: Huge appeal and the finger goes up! Trapped in front by {bowler}! {batter} is given out LBW, struck on the front pad plumb in front of middle.
LBW! {bowler} nips one back in from outside off, {batter} plays all around it and is hit on the back pad. Dead in front, has to go.
Rapped on the pads! {bowler} gets one to straighten from the off side and it would have hit middle and leg. The umpire has no hesitation.
Stone dead! A full delivery from {bowler} swings back in late and catches {batter} right in front of all three stumps. Easy decision for the umpire.
Pinned him! {bowler} bowls a quicker one that skids through low and hits the pad before {batter} can bring his bat down. LBW, out!
Trapped! The arm ball from {bowler} goes on straight with the angle, {batter} was expecting it to turn and is struck on the knee roll. Absolutely plumb.
That's gone! {bowler} fires one in full on middle stump, {batter} tries to flick but misses and is hit flush on the pads. The umpire raises the finger slowly.
Big shout from {bowler} and the umpire agrees! {batter} was hit on the back pad trying to work it across the line. Going on to hit leg stump, out LBW.
Huge appeal! The spinner gets one to grip and turn sharply into the pads. {batter} was playing for the turn that never came. Given out LBW!
In-swinger and it's crashing into the pads! {bowler} gets one to hoop back in and {batter} is trapped in front. That was going to demolish middle stump.

wicket_run_out.text: Run out! Brilliant piece of fielding! A direct hit from the deep and {batter} is caught well short of the crease. The replays confirm it.
Disaster! A mix-up between the batters and there's a run out! {batter} is stranded in the middle of the pitch. Terrible running between the wickets.
Sent back and too late! {batter} set off for the single but was sent back by his partner. The throw comes in to the keeper's end and the bails are off.
Run out by a whisker! The fielder swoops in from point, underarms it to the keeper and {batter} is just short. The third umpire gives it out!
Caught short! {batter} tried to steal a second run but the throw from deep mid-wicket is flat and accurate. The stumps are broken, well short.
Suicidal running! {batter} responded to the call but there was never a single there. The fielder at mid-on lobs it to the bowler who whips the bails off.
Direct hit from the boundary! What an arm on that fielder! {batter} was trying to come back for the second and is run out by a bullet throw.
Gone! A sharp piece of work from the fielding side. The ball goes to backward point, quick pick up, rifle throw, and the stumps are down. {batter} has to go.
Lazy running and it costs a wicket! {batter} didn't ground the bat and the throw beats him to the crease. A needless dismissal.
What a throw! The fielder picks up on the run at deep cover and hits the one stump he can see from forty yards. {batter} is run out, incredible athleticism!

wicket_stumped.text: Stumped! {batter} dances down the pitch but can't get to the ball. Quick as a flash, the keeper whips the bails off. Well stumped!
Out of his crease and stumped! {batter} charges down the track to {bowler} but the ball turns away. The keeper does the rest.
Beaten in the flight! {batter} comes down the pitch, the ball dips and spins past the outside edge. Lightning glovework from the keeper, stumped!
Smart bowling from {bowler}! Sees {batter} advancing, fires it wide outside off, and the keeper collects and breaks the stumps in one motion. Out, stumped!
Stumped down the leg side! {bowler} drags it down leg, {batter}'s back foot lifts for just a moment and the keeper is sharp enough to strike.
Out! {batter} dances out of his ground looking to smash it over the top, misses completely, and the keeper has the bails off before {batter} can recover.
Deceived by the slower one! {batter} is down the pitch but the ball holds its line. Left stranded, the keeper completes a tidy stumping.
Lovely piece of work all around! {bowler} flights it beautifully, {batter} is lured out of the crease, beaten on the turn, and stumped by the razor-sharp keeper.

dot.text: Solid forward defense from {batter}. Gets right behind the line of the ball and blocks it dead.
Beaten! A beauty of a delivery from {bowler} that moves away late past the outside edge. Close!
Driven straight to the fielder at point. Good timing but straight to the man, no run available.
Short ball ducked underneath by {batter}. Well directed bouncer but safely negotiated.
Play and a miss! {batter} attempts a loose drive away from his body and is lucky not to edge that.
Defended back down the pitch to the bowler. {bowler} fields it on his follow-through.
Leaves that one alone outside the off stump. Good judgement shown by {batter}.
Pushed to mid-on, {batter} thinks about the single but wisely stays put. Good fielding keeps it to a dot.
Good length delivery, {batter} gets behind it and blocks solidly. Keeping out the good ones.
Back of a length, not enough width to free the arms. {batter} defends watchfully on the back foot.
Appeal for LBW! Not given. Hit outside the line says the umpire. {bowler} is convinced but has to walk back.
Almost played on! The ball clips the inside edge and just misses leg stump by a coat of paint. {batter} exhales in relief.
Hit on the pads! There's an appeal but it pitched outside leg. Not out. {bowler} shakes his head and walks back.
Worked to square leg, fielder is quick off the mark and cuts off the single. Good ground fielding keeps the pressure on.
Slower ball from {bowler} and {batter} spots it early, pulls out of the shot. Just defends it back down the track.
Nothing to hit there! {bowler} lands it on a nagging length just outside off stump. {batter} wisely shoulders arms.
Swinging and missing! {batter} goes for an expansive drive but the ball wasn't there for the shot. Beaten all ends up.
Blocked with soft hands. The ball drops at his feet and dies. No run, but {batter} is seeing it nicely.
Just over the stumps! That kicked off a length from {bowler}, extra bounce surprised {batter} but went harmlessly over the bails.
Punched to cover, excellent stop diving to his left! That saves a certain boundary. Kept to a dot by brilliant fielding.

single.text: Soft hands used by {batter}, pushed gently towards mid-off and they scamper through for a quick single.
Worked away nicely with the wrists to square leg, finding the gap for an easy routine single.
Dropped at his feet and they decide to run! A direct hit would have been close, but they make it home safely.
Guided down to third man for a single. Sensible batting, rotating the strike and keeping the scoreboard ticking.
Punched off the back foot to deep cover. The fielder runs around to tidy up, keeping it down to just a single.
Inside edge onto the pad, the ball trickles away to the leg side and they pinch a cheeky single.
Driven firmly to mid-on, misfield allows them to go through! That should have been a dot ball.
Nudged off the hip to fine leg. Easy single, {batter} is rotating the strike well here.
Dabbed down to third man. Not the most glamorous shot but it does the job. One run added.
Tapped to the off side and they call quickly. Good running between the wickets converts a tight single. Well judged.
Played into the gap at mid-wicket with nice timing. Easy single, keeping the scoreboard moving along.
Defended into the covers, they think about two but settle for one. Sensible cricket, no need to take risks.
Off the pads, just wide of the fielder at short leg. They scurry through for a single, good awareness from both batters.
Steered to backward point and they set off immediately. Sharp running, the throw comes in but they're home comfortably.
Tucked off the pads to the leg side. One run. {batter} is keeping things ticking over nicely.
Pushed towards mid-off, the fielder has to run to his right and they take the single. Good placement from {batter}.

double.text: Placed into the gap at deep mid-wicket! Excellent running between the wickets, they come back for the second comfortably.
Pushed through the covers and they're running hard! The throw comes in from the deep but they make it back for two. Good cricket.
Cut away to deep point and they push for the second. The throw is slightly wide and they're home safely. Two runs.
Whipped off the pads to deep square leg! They turn quickly and come back for two. Excellent running between the wickets by both batters.
Driven to the long-off boundary! The fielder does well to cut it off but can only hold it to two. Nearly went all the way.
Pulled away to deep mid-wicket, the fielder slides to stop it near the rope. Two runs, saved a boundary there with good fielding.
Played into the gap at wide mid-on and they are quick between the wickets. Easy two, no drama involved.
Miscued towards long-on but there's enough distance to come back for two. Not off the middle of the bat but they'll take it.
Flicked off the pads and it bisects the two fielders in the deep. Comfortable two, smart batting from {batter}.
Guided to third man and they scamper back for the second! Quick call, quick running, and they beat the throw. Two valuable runs.

three.text: Driven to the deep and it beats the sweeper! They run three as the fielder has to chase it all the way to the fence. Held to three by a desperate dive.
Misfield in the outfield! The ball slips through the fingers and they run three while the fielder scrambles to recover. Sloppy work in the field.
Pulled away to deep mid-wicket, the fielder has a long chase! They take three, outstanding running between the wickets. {batter} is barely breathing!
Cut hard to deep backward point and they push for three! The throw is wayward and they complete the third run comfortably. Three runs.
Driven down the ground, the ball beats the fielder at long-off who has to turn and chase. They push for three and just make it. Tight!
Overthrow! The throw from the deep goes past the stumps and they get an extra run. Three in total, a bonus run from the fielding side's error.
Lofted over the infield to the deep! The fielder runs around from long-on and dives to keep it in. Three runs taken, could have been four.
Worked away through the leg side and they run hard! Three completed with a brilliant piece of running. {batter} slides his bat in just in time.

wide.text: Wayward line down the leg side, the umpire stretches his arms. Wide called.
Too wide outside off stump, chasing the tramlines. Umpire calls it a wide, free run.
Bouncer goes way over the head of {batter}! The square leg umpire signals a wide for height.
Slipping down the leg side again! {bowler} is struggling with his line here. Wide signalled, the captain won't be pleased.
That's gone miles down the leg side! Even the keeper struggled to collect it. Wide called, sloppy delivery.
Sprayed well outside off stump. {batter} left it alone and the umpire extends both arms. Wide, and rightly so.
Wide! The slower ball from {bowler} drifts too far down the leg side. Bonus run for the batting side.
That's a wide! Trying the bouncer but it's too high and too wide. Umpire has no hesitation in signalling.

noball.text: Huge shout for a wicket but the umpire signals No Ball! {bowler} has overstepped the line considerably.
It's a No Ball for height! That full toss was dangerously high above the waist. Free hit coming up!
No Ball! {bowler} has overstepped the crease. A free run and a free hit on the way for the batting side. Pressure on the bowler.
Front foot no ball! {bowler} was right on the line and the third umpire confirms his front foot has landed beyond the crease. Free hit next ball!
No ball called! {bowler} trying too hard for extra pace and has overstepped in the process. Gift for the batting side.
That's a no ball for height! Full toss above waist height, that could have been dangerous. Free hit coming up, {batter} will be licking his lips.

byes.text: Past the keeper! The ball beats everyone including the wicketkeeper, byes signalled. Runs added to the extras column.
Byes! That took an awkward bounce and beat the keeper who dives in vain. The batters run through for byes.
Through to the keeper... oh, he's fumbled it! The batters are alert and steal a run. Byes conceded.
The ball clips the top of off stump but somehow the bail stays on! It deflects past the keeper and they run through. Byes.

legbyes.text: Off the pads and away to the leg side! Leg byes signalled by the umpire. The batters take the run.
Struck on the pad, no shot offered but the ball runs away to fine leg. Leg bye taken, the umpire signals accordingly.
Hits the thigh pad and deflects to square leg. The batters run through for leg byes. {bowler} is frustrated, beating the bat but not getting rewarded.
Off the hip and it rolls towards fine leg. Leg bye signalled. Not off the bat, but the batters take advantage and run through.

free_hit.text: Free hit! {batter} swings hard and connects! But it's straight to the fielder in the deep. Can't be out though, it's a free hit. Dot ball.
Free hit delivery and {batter} launches it! It sails over the boundary for six! Making the most of the free hit opportunity!
Free hit and {batter} crunches it through the covers for four! That's the way to capitalize on a no-ball. Free runs!
Free hit but {batter} can't take advantage. Swings and misses, the ball goes through to the keeper. A reprieve wasted.

collapse_wicket: Another one bites the dust! {team} are falling apart here. The dug-out looks extremely worried.
The procession continues! Batsmen are coming and going like a revolving door. {team} in deep trouble.
Absolute disaster for {team}! They are losing wickets in clumps and the innings is unraveling fast.
Panic stations now! A collapse is unfolding right before our eyes. Someone needs to anchor this innings.
Wickets tumbling here! {team} are in a complete mess, and the body language in the dugout says it all.
The wheels are coming off for {team}! They simply cannot stem the bleeding here. This is turning into a rout.
high_pressure_dot: Swing and a miss! Nerves of steel from {bowler}. The crowd is on the edge of their seats!
The pressure is mounting with every dot ball! The required rate is climbing and the tension is palpable.
You can hear a pin drop in the stadium! The tension is unbearable as another ball passes without a run.
Gold dust! A dot ball at this stage is massive for the fielding side. The batter looks frustrated.
Dot ball! The equation is getting tougher by the delivery. The asking rate is spiralling out of control.
Can't find the boundary! {batter} is struggling to get it off the square. The pressure is immense.
partnership_50: That's the 50 partnership! These two are rebuilding the innings nicely and looking comfortable in the middle.
A solid stand developing here. 50 runs added between these two, bringing some stability back to the innings.
Frustration growing for {fielding_team} as this partnership crosses the 50-run mark. They need a breakthrough.
Fifty-run partnership! These two have batted intelligently and rotated the strike brilliantly. Good foundation being laid.
Half-century stand! A really important partnership in the context of this match. Both batters looking settled.
milestone_50: Fifty for {batter}! A well-compiled innings under pressure. Raises the bat to acknowledge the applause.
He raises his bat to the crowd! A fighting half-century from {batter}, playing a crucial role for his team.
Great knock! {batter} reaches his fifty with style. He has looked in fine touch since ball one.
Fifty up for {batter}! He punches the air and acknowledges the dressing room. What an innings this has been.
Half-century! {batter} gets to the milestone and the crowd rises to applaud. A measured innings of real quality.
milestone_100: HUNDRED! What a magnificent innings from {batter}! He takes off his helmet and soaks in the applause.
Take a bow, {batter}! A century to remember. This has been a masterclass in batting.
Ton up! {batter} reaches the magical three figures. A truly special performance on the big stage.
CENTURY! The crowd goes absolutely wild! {batter} leaps in the air, what an extraordinary knock this has been!
A hundred runs! {batter} raises his bat, kisses the badge on his helmet. This innings will be talked about for years.
expensive_over: Expensive over! The momentum is shifting back to the batting side. {bowler} will be disappointed with that effort.
Runs leaking now! {bowler} is under the pump as the batters capitalize on some loose deliveries.
Big over for the batting side! This could be the turning point of the match.
Runs flowing freely! The batters are cashing in and the bowling side is under serious pressure now.
That's gone for plenty! {bowler} has been taken to the cleaners in that over. The captain needs to think quickly.
maiden_over: Six dots in a row! A magnificent maiden over from {bowler} keeps the pressure firmly on.
Brilliant bowling! Completely tied down the batter for six balls. A maiden over is gold dust in this format.
Maiden! Just what the doctor ordered. {bowler} hitting the right areas consistently.
A rare maiden over in T20 cricket! {bowler} has been outstanding, not giving an inch to the batters.
Six balls, zero runs! {bowler} takes a moment to appreciate that. Exceptional discipline and control.
last_over_drama: It all comes down to this! Final over, nerves jangling on both sides. This is what cricket is all about!
Last over! The crowd is on their feet, every delivery could decide the match. Incredible scenes here!
Six balls to decide this contest! The tension is thick, you can feel it right through the television screen.
close_finish: What a finish! This match has gone right down to the wire. Edge-of-the-seat stuff!
Nailbiting finish! Both teams gave everything out there. That's why we love this game!
It couldn't have been any closer! Heart rates through the roof in both camps.
big_over: That over has changed the complexion of this match! The batting side has seized the momentum.
A massive over! The required rate has dropped significantly. The pressure is shifting back onto the bowlers.
What an over that was! The batting side has broken free and the runs are flowing.
death_overs: Into the death overs now! This is where reputations are made and matches are won.
The business end of the innings is here. Every ball counts from here on in.
Slog overs! The batters will be looking to tee off and maximize every delivery.
powerplay: Powerplay is on! Only two fielders allowed outside the circle. The batters will be looking to capitalize.
Inside the powerplay, fielding restrictions in play. This is where the batting side needs to set the platform.
Powerplay cricket! Aggressive fields, attacking bowling, this is the most exciting phase of the game.
